headline.main: NC State Fraternity Disbanded Over Offensive Notebook
headline.print_headline: NC State Fraternity Disbanded Over Offensive Notebook

docs.snippet: North Carolina State University disbanded a fraternity chapter Wednesday following the discovery of a notebook filled with sexist and racially offensive entries in a restaurant off campus....
docs.lead_paragraph: North Carolina State University disbanded a fraternity chapter Wednesday following the discovery of a notebook filled with sexist and racially offensive entries in a restaurant off campus.

headline.main: Appeals Court Hears Arguments on Maryland Gun-Control Law
headline.print_headline: Appeals Court Hears Arguments on Maryland Gun-Control Law

docs.snippet: The sweeping gun-control law Maryland enacted after the 2012 Sandy Hook Elementary School massacre impermissibly bans firearms that people commonly keep in their homes for self-defense, a lawyer for gun-rights advocates told a federal appeals cour...
docs.lead_paragraph: The sweeping gun-control law Maryland enacted after the 2012 Sandy Hook Elementary School massacre impermissibly bans firearms that people commonly keep in their homes for self-defense, a lawyer for gun-rights advocates told a federal appeals court Wednesday.

headline.main: Heavy Rains in Northern Chile Leave Thousands Cut Off
headline.print_headline: Heavy Rains in Northern Chile Leave Thousands Cut Off

docs.snippet: Heavy rains in Chile's northern desert regions have caused mudslides and rivers to breach their banks, leaving residents stranded and forcing several companies to suspend copper mining operations in the world's No.1 producer....
docs.lead_paragraph: Heavy rains in Chile's northern desert regions have caused mudslides and rivers to breach their banks, leaving residents stranded and forcing several companies to suspend copper mining operations in the world's No.1 producer.

headline.main: Friends Seek Financial Aid for Family of U.S. Civil Rights Leader Fauntroy
headline.print_headline: Friends Seek Financial Aid for Family of U.S. Civil Rights Leader Fauntroy

docs.snippet: Friends of civil rights leader Walter Fauntroy, who left Washington for the Middle East in 2012 and refuses to come home, asked the public on Wednesday to help his family financially....
docs.lead_paragraph: Friends of civil rights leader Walter Fauntroy, who left Washington for the Middle East in 2012 and refuses to come home, asked the public on Wednesday to help his family financially.

headline.main: Delta Rocket Blasts Off From Florida With Improved GPS Satellite
headline.print_headline: Delta Rocket Blasts Off From Florida With Improved GPS Satellite

docs.snippet: An unmanned Delta 4 rocket blasted off from Florida on Wednesday to deliver the ninth of 12 next-generation Global Positioning System satellites into orbit....
docs.lead_paragraph: An unmanned Delta 4 rocket blasted off from Florida on Wednesday to deliver the ninth of 12 next-generation Global Positioning System satellites into orbit.

headline.main: Serena Williams Hoping to Play at Miami Open
headline.print_headline: Serena Williams Hoping to Play at Miami Open

docs.snippet: Less than one week after Serena Williams withdrew from her Indian Wells semifinal with a knee injury, the two-time Miami Open defending champion said on Wednesday she's hoping to be fit to play on Friday night....
docs.lead_paragraph: Less than one week after Serena Williams withdrew from her Indian Wells semifinal with a knee injury, the two-time Miami Open defending champion said on Wednesday she's hoping to be fit to play on Friday night.

headline.main: PayPal to Pay $7.7M in Sanctions Violations Settlement
headline.print_headline: PayPal to Pay $7.7M in Sanctions Violations Settlement

docs.snippet: PayPal Inc. has agreed to pay $7.7 million to settle with U.S. regulators who said the payments company allowed violations of U.S. sanctions against Iran, Cuba and Sudan....
docs.lead_paragraph: PayPal Inc. has agreed to pay $7.7 million to settle with U.S. regulators who said the payments company allowed violations of U.S. sanctions against Iran, Cuba and Sudan.

headline.main: Newspaper Received Email Claiming to Be From Woman's Captors
headline.print_headline: Newspaper Received Email Claiming to Be From Woman's Captors

docs.snippet: The San Francisco Chronicle says it received an email from an anonymous person claiming to be holding a California woman who was found safe Wednesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: The San Francisco Chronicle says it received an email from an anonymous person claiming to be holding a California woman who was found safe Wednesday.

headline.main: No One Hurt When De-Icing Truck Hits Plane at Denver Airport
headline.print_headline: No One Hurt When De-Icing Truck Hits Plane at Denver Airport

docs.snippet: No injuries have been reported after a de-icing truck hit a Delta Air Lines plane at Denver International Airport....
docs.lead_paragraph: No injuries have been reported after a de-icing truck hit a Delta Air Lines plane at Denver International Airport.

headline.main: Arizona Police: Woman Flashed, Abused Boys at Bar Mitzvah
headline.print_headline: Arizona Police: Woman Flashed, Abused Boys at Bar Mitzvah

docs.snippet: A Scottsdale woman has been arrested for allegedly exposing her newly augmented breasts to adults and children and performing a sex act on a teenage boy at a bar mitzvah....
docs.lead_paragraph: A Scottsdale woman has been arrested for allegedly exposing her newly augmented breasts to adults and children and performing a sex act on a teenage boy at a bar mitzvah.
